DOCNAME: CASE OF SANDEL v. "THE FORMER YUGOSLAV REPUBLIC OF MACEDONIA"
JUDGES: Isabelle Berro-Lefèvre;Karel Jungwiert;Mirjana Lazarova Trajkovska;Peer Lorenzen;Rait Maruste;Renate Jaeger;Zdravka Kalaydjieva
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was arrested on suspicion of fraud . On DATE he was brought before an investigating judge of ORG ( “ the trial court ” ) . TIME held on that date recorded that he had an insufficient command of NORP , but that he would agree , if need be , to have some phrases re - read or explained in detail . However , in the absence of his lawyer he remained silent . The investigation started and the applicant was remanded in custody . On DATE he was again brought before the investigating judge and this time , in the presence of his lawyer , he produced evidence in NORP stating that he had a limited command of NORP . He gave his testimony in the presence of PERSON , a court - certified interpreter . He signed the minutes without making any comment or objection .

CARDINAL . On DATE the public prosecutor lodged a bill of indictment . On CARDINAL DATE the applicant objected on the ground that the bill was defective because it was not supported by sufficient evidence . On DATE the trial court dismissed the applicant 's objection .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant appointed another lawyer to represent him in the proceedings .
CARDINAL . CARDINAL hearings fixed DATE were adjourned owing to the applicant 's request to use LANGUAGE , his mother tongue .
CARDINAL . On DATE he was released on bail .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date DATE , the trial court , at the applicant 's suggestion , appointed PERSON , a LANGUAGE - speaking employee in a GPE - based non - governmental organisation , as interpreter .
CARDINAL . A hearing fixed for DATE was rescheduled owing to the absence of Mr NORP

CARDINAL . On DATE an investigation started in respect of the applicant into CARDINAL other counts of fraud . On DATE the public prosecutor lodged an indictment against the applicant . On DATE the applicant objected on the ground of lack of evidence to support the charges against him . He also requested that the bill of indictment be translated into LANGUAGE . On DATE , in the presence of the applicant and his second lawyer , the trial court dismissed the applicant 's objection .
CARDINAL . On DATE the trial court joined the CARDINAL sets of proceedings .

CARDINAL . DATE and DATE , the trial court fixed CARDINAL hearings of which CARDINAL were adjourned at the applicant 's request , CARDINAL owing to the absence of either an expert , who was called upon to provide an opinion of the applicant 's signature , the public prosecutor or PERSON and CARDINAL owing to the absence of the trial judge and a strike by the court administration . During this time , the proceedings were conducted with the assistance of PERSON In his presence , the court heard the applicant , the expert and several witnesses , CARDINAL of which were foreign nationals , and obtained an expert report on the applicant 's signature . At hearings on DATE and DATE , and DATE , the applicant confirmed his testimony given in the pre - trial proceedings and stated that he had understood the bills of indictment communicated to him .

CARDINAL . On DATE Mr E.F. left the ORG and informed the trial court that he could no longer provide interpretation . By DATE , QUANTITY hearings were postponed because the trial court could not secure the attendance of PERSON or another interpreter into LANGUAGE . At a hearing of DATE , the applicant insisted on having interpretation into LANGUAGE and refused the court 's offer of LANGUAGE or NORP interpretation . ORG stated that there was no court - certified interpreter into NORP registered in the respondent ORG who , under the rules of court , would be authorised to assist in court . ORG also replied that none of its members had sufficient command of LANGUAGE .

CARDINAL . According to TIME of the hearing held on DATE , the applicant stated that he had been living in the respondent ORG for DATE and had used LANGUAGE and NORP for everyday communication . However , since his command of these languages was limited , he had insisted on having interpretation into LANGUAGE .

CARDINAL . On DATE a GPE - based foreign language school issued a certificate attesting to the applicant 's level of NORP . According to the latter , the applicant had limited understanding of NORP ; he replied in NORP ; he could partly understand a written text if it was in LANGUAGE script but he could write only in NORP . The applicant stated that he had submitted this certificate to the court as evidence .

CARDINAL . At a hearing of DATE , the applicant stated that he used NORP , NORP , NORP and LANGUAGE for everyday communication . He signed contracts in LANGUAGE or LANGUAGE . In case something had to be added , he would ask his sons in GPE , in LANGUAGE , to translate the relevant part into LANGUAGE .

CARDINAL . At a hearing of CARDINAL DATE , the applicant , when asked by the court , stated that he “ used NORP , NORP and LANGUAGE for everyday communication , but ... could not write or read in these languages or use them in the proceedings ” . The applicant further stated that in the pre - trial proceedings , meaning the questioning of DATE , he had made his statement in NORP – despite having limited command of it – on the instructions of his lawyer , who , he alleged , had been working in concert with the police and who had set him up to sign the minutes .
CARDINAL . In view of the applicant 's statements , on DATE the trial court appointed CARDINAL interpreters into LANGUAGE , NORP and NORP , one of whom was PERSON
CARDINAL . From DATE the proceedings were conducted with the assistance of these CARDINAL interpreters . CARDINAL adjournments were ordered owing to the applicant 's absence .

CARDINAL . On DATE the trial court ordered , at the applicant 's request , that the bills of indictment of DATE and DATE , be translated into LANGUAGE and LANGUAGE . On DATE the applicant returned the translated versions saying that he was proficient only in LANGUAGE .

CARDINAL . From DATE , a third lawyer represented the applicant in the proceedings . At a hearing of DATE , the trial court refused his request for all documents in the case file to be translated into LANGUAGE since they had already been orally translated by PERSON , in whose presence the court had admitted other evidence .

CARDINAL . At hearings held on DATE and DATE and after the applicant 's lawyer had given extensive concluding remarks , the trial court convicted the applicant and sentenced him to DATE and DATE imprisonment . It also ordered a security measure – expulsion from the respondent ORG for DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged an appeal written in LANGUAGE . At the trial court 's request , he submitted a certified copy in NORP . He complained that , inter alia , he had not been given the right to use LANGUAGE even though the trial court had accepted that he had a limited command of LANGUAGE and LANGUAGE . He argued that his initial statement in NORP had been made under duress . He further complained that evidence against him had been admitted in the form of photocopies .

CARDINAL . At a public hearing held on DATE , ORG dismissed the applicant 's appeal . It rejected his arguments concerning the use of LANGUAGE , relying on his initial statement of DATE made in NORP and the fact that all the admitted evidence had been translated into LANGUAGE with the assistance of Mr E.F. It also stated that his appeal had been translated into NORP by an interpreter certified by the court to translate into NORP , which suggested that the applicant 's insistence on the use of LANGUAGE had been aimed at prolonging the proceedings . It further rejected his complaints about the use of evidence in the form of photocopies , stating that it had not been possible to admit it in original form as it had meanwhile been destroyed .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant submitted an appeal on points of law ( барање за вонредно преиспитување на правосилна пресуда ) to ORG in which he reiterated his complaints that he had been denied the right to use LANGUAGE , the only language of which he had sufficient command . He complained that the trial court , after being unable to secure the presence of a suitable interpreter , imposed the use of NORP and other languages , even though it had established earlier in the proceedings that he could not use them proficiently . In this connection he complained about the rejection of his request to have an interpreter from abroad , even though PERSON E.F. was an NORP . He further complained that he had not been informed , in a language which he understood , of the nature and cause of the accusation . Lastly , he complained about the use of evidence in the form of photocopies .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant 's appeal on points of law . It held that the proceedings had been conducted in a language which the applicant understood , relying on the depositions taken on DATE in the pre - trial proceedings and the fact that all the evidence had been translated into LANGUAGE by Mr E.F. It also held that the applicant had had , throughout the entire proceedings , defence counsel of his own choosing . It further dismissed the remaining complaints finding no grounds for departing from the reasoning given by the lower courts . No information was provided as to the date of service of this decision .
CARDINAL . On DATE the President of the ORG granted the applicant early release from prison .
CARDINAL . During the proceedings , the applicant requested , on several occasions , that the trial court and ORG speed up the proceedings .
